content.description: The graph of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> shown above consists of three line segments. Let <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x, equals, the integral from, 0 to x, of, f of t, d t" overflow="scroll"> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <msubsup> <mrow> <mo>∫</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>0</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>ⅆ</mo> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </math>.
content.question: At what value of <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> does <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> attain its absolute maximum on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 4 comma 3, close bracket" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 6.5: Interpreting the Behavior of Accumulation Functions Involving Area

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
